title: The Myth of Multitasking
description: Many people pride themselves on being able to juggle multiple tasks at once. But research shows that multitasking is actually a productivity killer.
body:
Many people pride themselves on being able to juggle multiple tasks at once. But research shows that multitasking is actually a productivity killer.

“You can do two things at once, but you can't focus effectively on two things at once.” — Gary Keller

Why is multitasking so problematic?

  • It increases mental fatigue
  • It causes more mistakes
  • It takes longer to complete each task

Instead, try single-tasking: focus on one thing, finish it, and move on. Your brain will thank you, and so will your to-do list.
